intro: Serjania sinuata subf. serratodentata, commonly known as the Brazilian serjania, is a species within the family Sapotaceae. It is characterized by its woody structure and typical tropical rainforest habitat. The plant features simple, alternate leaves with serrated margins, which contribute to its common name. Its flowers are small and clustered, usually greenish-yellow in color, and it produces inedible, woody fruits. This subspecies is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is often found in humid, lowland areas.
